result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek W Langan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek W Langan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derek W Langan was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Derek W Langan was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: re: Revocation of Huber - So Ordered
from JCJ notifying the Court that Huber has been revoked
Sent to Defendant 1)NOH x2//sent to JCJ; Not in Custody
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Cases 15CM397 & 15CM481 called together at 3:36 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Derek W Langan in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified by ADA Shock, as there are no statutory victims. Court so finds Chapter 950 compliance.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #2 & #3-15CM481; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1-15CM481 and case 15CM397, jeopardy attaches and further prosecution is barred.

On Count #2-15CM481, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence forthwith 
--2 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $443 + $50 drug testing fee = $493; due in $30 increments per month beginning 8/24/16 no later than 4:00 pm and on the 24th day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.

On Count #3-15CM481, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 10 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence consecutive to Count #2
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $443; due in $30 increments per month beginning 8/24/16 no later than 4:00 pm and on the 24th day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 9 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.
--To submit DNA Sample today at JESO
Recess: 3:56 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Cases 15CM397 and 15CM481 called together at 1:32am [mo]
Defendant Derek W Langan appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Bond Arguments given by Counsel
The Court reinstates the bonds in each case.
The Court schedules this case for plea/sentencing.
recess: 1:38pm



NEXT: Plea/Sentencing on 6/24/16 at 3:30pm
2 Duplicate Original Warrant's received from JCSD - Defendant is in custody

Scheduled for Plea and Sentencing:

Cases 15CM397 and 15CM481 called together at 1:10pm [mo]
Defendant Derek W Langan does NOT appear in court.
Attorney Whitney Hagemann appears in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.

Atty. Hagemann has no explanation for Mr. Langan's non appearance
The Court finds bond to be in default and orders the bonds to be forfeited
The Court issues bench warrants in each case, body only.

recess: 1:12pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Cases 15CM481 and 15CM397 called together at 10:22am [mo]
Defendant Derek W Langan in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa on behalf of Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that resolution is near
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
recess: 10:25am

NEXT: AS TO BOTH CASES: Plea and Sentencing on 6/20/16 at 1:00pm

Cases 15CM481 and 15CM397 called together at 2:20pm [mo]
Defendant Derek W Langan in court with attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaints are correct. 
Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in each of the Criminal Complaints. 
Pleas of "not guilty" entered on both cases; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court continues the already posted $500 CASH bond in Case 15CM397, it is to now cover cases 15CM481 and 15CM397, with the added conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess: 2:25pm


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/16/16 at 10:00am    (2)  Status Conference on 5/3/16 at 10:00am
